title: Amazing staff
body:
The staff here are amazing! I had never been to this hospital before and was very nervous but the staff made me feel calm and safe. Made my day so much easier. Amazing staff and thank you all very much. AIR HUGS!
Francesca Lunn

readBy.name: The Robert Jones and Agnes Hunt Orthopaedic Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care
body: I would like to express my gratitude for the staff at the dental hospital! I have been before today and as always like today received top class service and expertise! Thank you again for your help especially in this trying time For everyone but especially for hospital staff! Always make me feel at ease and nothing is too much trouble! üëèüèªüëèüèªFor the nhs!

title: Wonderful Practice Nurses
body: Very efficient and professional service provision by the staff involved in administering injections in the surgery car park today at the height of the Coronavirus pandemic. Special thanks to the two nurses in full personal protective equipment who sang happy 50th birthday to my wife from across the car park. Very thoughtful, even if a little surreal! Can‚Äôt thank them enough.

title: great practice
body:
i was in terrible pain for days with a tooth. i had an appointment
at heavitree hospital, exeter at the dental unit. and the treatment from the moment i arrived was exceptional, everyone was so professional, polite and the place was ultra clean. the dentist and his assistant were just wonderful and put me at ease during a very painful time. thank you nhs....

title: Great practice
body:
Mersea surgery have demonstrated a very high level of care towards me. From receiving my set of irregular blood tests and ensuring I was referred for the appropriate scans, to making a quick referral to my oncologist consultant, and taking extra care during blood tests,  I have felt that the surgery is doing above and beyond. The reception staff have accommodated my wishes not to sit in the waiting room whilst on chemotherapy and have always demonstrated patience and kindness.  Sick notes and referrals have been completed quickly.  
THANK YOU.

title: Appalling
body: Rude doctor because I known to mental health services , she said to me what are u doing here ? Rude unprofessional, struggling with severe mental health but walked out because of rude doctor

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust
Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

title: Terrible and rude receptionist
body: How this surgery treats a patient is unbelievable! Sheer lack of importance shown to the patient needed a letter for a medical for a university exam and got treated like a was dirt on the receptionists shoe!!. After severable attempts of begging them to speed up the process no letter was given! And once given I missed my exam deadline to submit! Luckily enough went to another surgery locally and they did it on the same day! And did not give me any grief!! Worse thing is I was charged the money for the letter before even receiving it! What a con of a surgery! Not that this surgery will take notice of my review! Will just get a generic I‚Äôm sorry reply if I‚Äôm lucky!!!

title: slow running practice
body:
Don't expect to be seen on time. Even when you're first in the clinic the doctors arrive late. 
Most of the doctors perform as expected, but the reception staff believe themselves to be practising GPs, to the point they gave bad advise that led to taking my child to a&e. In the whole practice has lack of communication..

title: Online search for other
body: Most highly recommend helpfully reception service..in these times to help locate a surgery for a elderly relative.m

title: Quality Care
body:
I visited A&E yesterday on advice from my GP. Considering the difficult times the NHS are experiencing I can honestly say my experience from check-in through to treatment the staff were exceptional.
I was treat with courtesy, compassion and a genuine feeling all the staff had a real care to looking after me and elevating my concerns.
I left knowing that they had done everything they could treatment wise and follow up action would continue through my GP.
Hats off to you all in the NHS and thanks for looking after me. ‚ù§Ô∏è

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding practice
body:
For nearly 50 years Richmond has taken care of all our family  whenever needed. They have coped with the enormous patient increase and continously upgraded their services. Doctors have come and gone over this time but the wonderful service has never varied. Know the pressures you are all under and just want to thank you all from the bottom of our hearts. Keep safe.

One of the oldies you persist in keeping alive!
üëè üëè üëè

title: Excellent practice with helpful doctors and‚Ä¶
body:
I have only excellent things to say about Keats Group Practice and have found all the doctors to be caring, helpful and efficient. It has always been easy to telephone and arrange an appointment at short notice if needed and the online booking system has always worked well for me. I should also mention that the staff at reception are always friendly and very helpful. 
I have recently been diagnosed with a more serious illness and the doctor I saw about it was extremely helpful in getting me a quick referral to the relevant hospital department and took a personal interest in my treatment and wellbeing. She telephoned me several times at home to find out how I was doing, which I really appreciated. 
Hard to find a better surgery!

title: wonderful staff
body:
The doctors and all other staff in the practice are very professional ,hard working and very caring.
I have been with this practice for more than 30 years and as i have got older i feel more secure and satisfied that whatever medical problems i have they will do their best to help me

author: Angryperson
title: Medication
body:
I went to the Handcross Pharmacy to collect my monthly medication, I always go a couple of days later when it is due, as I know they are busy. I get there to be told they are a week and a half behind, I also had concerns as I had been recently diagnosed with Angina and the hospital had put me on Bisoprolol, I am also on Apixaban. So to me these are quite important and had a couple of days left of supply.  
I then had a member of staff from the Pharmacy shout at me, who gave me my prescription and said nothing was in stock and to take this to the local Chemist. I am disgusted the way I was treated, I have been with this Surgery for 6 years and over the years, I feel that the Pharmacy and Reception have deteriorated dramatically. The old staff were helpful and amazing in my opinion. The staff they have now I feel show no compassion and don't know how to talk to people, if it be on the phone or in front of them. I have read other reviews and it's always about the Reception and Pharmacy.  
May I add the Doctors are great.

title: "Who are you, again?"
body:
I am a long term user of this practice with ongoing medical issues so have to use the service frequently.
The reception staff have the weird ability to treat you as if they have never seen you before and have absolutely no idea who you are.
Communication is poor,  letters from from hospital consultants seem to be ignored and trying to resolve any issue always involves multiple phone calls.
I understand it is a busy place and the intention of the staff is good they are under pressure and doing their best but I feel it could be more professionally managed.

title: Beware
body: There are 2 very good male GPs but beware of the female. I saw her 3 times when I had a persistent cough & fever for 2 weeks (some time ago, before Covid just didn't want to give them a bad review), she always told me just to rest and take fluids cause it was a flu. I went to another GP and in the first 5 minutes he heard my cough and said he didn't like the sound so order X-Rays. I had pneumonia which can be very dangerous and it was never diagnosed by the female GP. As other have mentioned, she is  extremely rude and not knowledgeable GP, best to avoid her.

title: Needs improvement in: Communication and Repeat‚Ä¶
body:
The repeat prescription process seems to encounter problems too often and as a patient you only find out when you go and collect your prescription to find out that it hasn't been issued.
If the patient needs tests before you can renew the drug, or if the request was submitted a bit early or if there is a note attached then please read it and communicate if there are any issues about it. 
Somebody makes the decision to not issue the script but they don't let you know about it so it is a waste of time for everyone. Please improve this service as it is getting very frustrating and it isn't hard to fix.

title: Disgraceful
body:
My first experience was about two years ago. My initial assessment ended up lasting a few sessions which is understandable because my life has been very complex. I was then told to await a letter in the post which will have an appt date on to start the therapy. This never arrived. I phoned to chase it. They apologised and said they‚Äôre posting it for me now. It never arrived but interestingly, what did arrive was a letter to say I‚Äôd missed an appt and will be discharged from services. 

This time round in 2020, I had an over the phone initial appt where I was very honest and explained things. I received a letter in the post today telling me I‚Äôm being discharged from services because I‚Äôm a risk and that I should go to anger management. Things on the report were also factually incorrect. I had not refused medications. This is appalling. I have been diagnosed with BPD by a psychiatrist. I have been managing my anger for several years and haven‚Äôt acted out. I have bad thoughts but I‚Äôve controlled myself. This is what I was saying on the phone! I asked for help because I don‚Äôt want to start acting on my thoughts when I‚Äôve done so well to hold back so far. This was the final straw. Adios.

readBy.name: Hertfordshire Partnership University NHS Foundation Trust

author: Sarah-321
title: We will be forever grateful to all the midwives
body:
Throughout my pregnancy I had several episodes of reduced movements so called the maternity triage number. Each time I was seen quickly and always felt like my concerns were taken seriously.  
The day before my due date in January, I had another episode of reduced movements so was admitted to be induced. The plan was to break my waters overnight but due to the acuity of the ward it wasn't possible. I was kept on the monitor overnight and all the midwives and obstetricians I saw were caring, compassionate and kept me well informed. My husband was allowed to stay overnight and was fed by the domestics (it was greatly appreciated). The following day my waters were broken and my midwife Julie and student nurse Kat were amazing. Once my waters were broken my labour progressed quicker than expected so I did not require the induction drip. Julie kept me calm and helped me to get through labour with only entonox. Kat spoke to my husband throughout and kept him calm.  
My daughter was safely delivered two hours after my waters were broken. We will be forever grateful to Julie, Kat and all the hospital and community midwives we met throughout my pregnancy.  
My husband was allowed to stay in hospital with us the night following my daughters birth, I strongly believe this helped me to succeed with breastfeeding. Having his support through the night when I was exhausted really helped me to stick with it. That night also allowed us to bond as a family unit and was such a precious time.  
Thank you for everything (and apologies for the delay in submitting our feedback).

author: Cowboy Hat
title: 48 days on Cleves Ward
body:
48 days on that ward.  
Complete Professionalism  
Excellent Standards  
No Compromises  
Superb Matrons Larissa and Laura/ Lara and a nurse that pulled me through my trauma Ameta

author: Kazza10
title: My diverticulitis flare
body:
I have suffered from diverticulitis for about 10 years. I manage the condition quite well from home. Of all the really wrong times for it to flare, it would be now. But that's what happened.  
I was taken into Forth Valley at Larbert on Tuesday morning. A more unwilling patient you would never meet, but the pain was in control and dictated I must stay.  
I was first in the Clinical Assessment Unit then onto B23.  
The staff on both areas were kindness personified  
Poor Rachel was rushed off her feet but still made the time to come to me every time I had to buzz when I was being sick. Bless her, she was there everytime (and there was a lot!). From the girls coming in with the tea, who showed me as much love and concern when I was crying, to Rachel, to wee Carol in the discharge room who ran to get my meds to let me home, each and every one, and everyone I haven't mentioned, I am deeply grateful to you all. I was terrified when I couldn't control the pain, or make the sickness stop, but you reassured me. Convinced me all would be well. And it is. Thank you all so very much girls. God bless you all xx

author: frankie1012003
title: My hospital experience
body:
I‚Äôd like to say a massive thank you to the staff in A+E and surgical ward at the Western Isles hospital for taking such good care of me on my recent admission with renal colic. I was in excruciating pain which came on suddenly whilst at work, thankfully I got down to A+E where I was seen promptly and my pain sorted immediately. I was treated with kindness , respect and compassion from everyone that I saw and when my pain returned again this was resolved immediately...With a working diagnosis from symptoms, Clinical indications and a previous scan they let me home at my own request with a plan in place to scan the next day and me under strict instructions to return If the pain returned as I was concerned about my dogs at home. Anyway best laid plans and I was back 2 hours later and again treated immediately with my pain acted on as a priority. I‚Äôm aware as a nurse renal colic is one of the most painful conditions you can suffer but I now will have a completely different respect for my Pts suffering from it.  
From A+E once they were happy I was comfortable I was transferred to surgical ward where I was greeted by the staff, made immediately comfortable in a bed, given further analgesia, cold water to drink and my paperwork dealt with quickly so that I could be left to get some much needed rest. The staff checked regular;y to make sure I was comfortable and had everything I needed and were again kind and considerate, cheery and respectful and that must be no easy task when caring for me. Thankfully I managed to pass the stone and my pain overall resolved but I had my scan promptly the next morning, and was allowed to go home. My discharge meds were prepared quickly so from me a massive shout out to everyone from the minute I entered through A+E, drs, nurses to the nurses, drs , domestics , pharmacist in surgical ward who without being biased are simply the best to the radiographers in X-ray...I for one am very proud to work for the NHS and although not the best 24 hours of my life I‚Äôll turn it into a positive and use it to reflect and be more compassionate and be able to empathise more with my Pts in similar situations

readBy.name: Office of Rhoda Grant, MSP for Highlands and Islands

author: LD91
title: Midwifery care
body:
My community midwife provided me with the best care I could have asked for during my pregnancy, birth and post natal care. She went above and beyond in her care for my baby and I, particularly with regards to helping me to breastfeed my baby, which enhanced the whole experience for me.  
The Midwife‚Äôs in the labour ward were also incredible, and I wish to thank them for their first class care - I could not have wished for a better birth or midwives.  
I would have benefited from more support to breastfeed on the postnatal ward, or for someone to have supported me there. However, as noted, my community midwife and health visitor later supported me - but I may have had more confidence and skill had this been available before going home.

author: Diard78
title: My dad's excellent care
body:
My dad was admitted as an emergency to ward 57 WGH via the SAU. The SAU had just moved that day due to Covid and staff were still getting used to their new area. Despite this every member of staff was welcoming, reassuring and informative.  
In ward 57, although not able to go in and see my dad, staff again were fantastic, informative and made every effort to provide information. My dad wants to express his thanks to every nurse, domestic, CSW, Porter and doctor who cared for him.  
These are challenging times for health staff and everyone who cared for my dad rose to and exceeded the challenge. He also said the food was great!

author: Barbiedoll
title: Dedication of staff
body:
I have nothing but praise for all the staff at Kings even before the current pandemic. I was referred from Medway Hospital Haematology Department in August 2019 as I had MDS and needed a Stem Cell Transplant. Everyone I have encountered has shown me such kindness and care from the cleaners to the consultants including pharmacy, receptionists, nurses, porters, radiographers and especially the transplant team. I owe them such a lot - thank you all so much.  
Barbiedoll

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: minnie the moocher
title: My husbands visit
body:
My husband, who has mixed dementia, managed to pull his catheter out causing a lot of trauma and blood loss. District nurse attended but decided he needed an ambulance. Because of his mental condition I was allowed to go with him.  
The staff were brilliant, everyone of them caring, professional and friendly. It turned out to be quite a complex procedure to fix him and we were there about 7 hours.  
I had to wear PPE which was so uncomfortable, how the staff do it day in and day out at the moment is amazing.  
Just want to say a HUGE THANK YOU to everyone.

author: Faraway
title: Covid 19 parents treatment
body:
My dad was taken in with suspected Covid 19 last Friday and my mum last Monday. Both have sadly passed away, mum on Monday dad on Tuesday.  
The treatment they received and the help given to my sister and myself from start to finish at all levels from the receptionist, to the ward and A+E staff and finally the nurse and junior doctor who where at each of our parents sides, holding their hands as they passed, was nothing more than absolutely fantastic. You all have nothing but our utmost respect and heartfelt thanks.  
My sister and I are both NHS workers but I work for a different board, so unfortunately I was too far away to travel and my poor sister was left with everything to do. It all went so quickly and even though my sister lives locally, she couldn't even get there in time. We are so grateful that someone was present at the end and that it was mercifully peaceful and quick for both of them.  
We appreciate all of your great work at this present difficult time, especially since we understand the current pressures and workload as fellow NHS workers and with our own involvement workwise. Stay safe and keep up the fantastic work and we will get through this together.

readBy.name: Office of Rhoda Grant, MSP for Highlands and Islands
University of Glasgow - School of Medicine, Dentistry and Nursing

author: Eiluned
title: a very big thank you to everyone who treated me
body:
a very big thank you to everyone who treated and helped me after 4 fractures in ankle  
I am writing to thank all the staff at Tameside hospital after fracturing my ankle in four places last October {2019) Firstly the ambulancemen made me feel at ease and with whom I had a lovely chat all the way to hospital. Taken to a and e where my very special male nurse helped, along with gas and air, to cope while the foot was straightened. I was taken to ward overnight and then taken to theatre. Again everyone who prepared me for theatre were so reassuring - Theatre nurse, doctor and anaesthetists. My operation took five hours. I cannot thank my surgeon enough. He is my hero. I will always be grateful for everything he did. I am at the moment in the over 70s group of people who are at risk of catching coronavirus Still okay at moment. Fingers crossed. Thank you to everyone who helped me a few months ago and also thank you to everyone working in the NHS today and over the next weeks  
[Unsure about 'Team work']

readBy.name: Tameside and Glossop Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: Boasonwheel
title: Care
body: l am a carer/parent, for my  Downs syndrome sonMy son spent a few days in ward 4E. He has learning difficulties and they very kindly allowed me to stay along with him. Have to say each and everyone of them from the outstanding doctors to the cleaners and everyone in between treated us with great respect, kindness and understanding. I have to take my hat off to them all They all restored my faith in humanity. God bless them all

title: Great practice
body: I was ill with coronavirus for 14 days and felt dreadful, during that time i rang 111 three times as i felt so ill. I decided to ring my surgery to try and speak to my own doctor. The call was handled very professionally by the receptionist and told me the doctor would call within 2 hours. After 1 hour my own doctor called back and gave me the reasurance i was looking for via facetime on the mobile phone. After that telephone call i just felt much better and was up and about within 24 hours.  Thank you for great service

title: good listener and reasurance
body: the doctor was reassuring as I know am I'll but don't know why or what? he listen, he made sense. put me at easy. as I am scared right now

title: Outstanding staff and practice!
body: A quick review to say thank you to all the lovely ladies who work so hard at the Clements surgery, always helpful and treat me like a person, not a number! Help has always been there before and after my major operation at the end of 2019 - they've always gone the extra mile and out of their way to help. If it wasn‚Äôt for them, I really don‚Äôt know what state I‚Äôll be in today! And the David Holland pharmacy next door - Awesome! Thank you all! üëçüèº

title: Kind and Caring.
body: I attended for my eye injections on Tuesday and was feeling quite emotional and distressed after being in self isolation(being Diabetic) for over two weeks.  However, everyone was so kind and understanding and so caring and I soon felt really  calm  . The department was so well organised with excellent safety measures in place. I could not have wished for better treatment and care. I have been attending the eye hospital for some years and have always found all the staff there to be really helpful and friendly with friendly smiles and conversation .They all do such an amazing job. I am nervous of needles but they have always done such a great job of helping me to remain calm and relaxed and very safe. I cannot thank them enough for all they do.  "Thank you all so much.  You are all amazing".

title: Great service in difficult times
body: Took my son to ED last night. He was treated really well by the staff there who are obviously under a lot of pressure given current circumstances. Thanks to all involved who got us home as soon as possible with a smile in their faces :-)

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Great Practice
body:
I have been with the surgery for over 25 years and they have always been there for me and my family. Now there is a global problem they are there for the whole community. 

I‚Äôd like to thank everyone there from the receptionists to the Doctors and nurses. 

It is easy to get a repeat prescription, easy to speak to a doctor on the phone and I even calls reminding me of certain things.

title: Great service
body: In these difficult times, UCC saw my son within minutes and he got prompt treatment. It just goes to show how many misuse the vital NHS services, and how efficient they can be when they are used in the correct way. Thanks

title: Amazing care & staff who go the extra mile
body: I recently gave birth, 3 weeks early and as a result myself and my newborn baby ended up staying in hospital for nearly 2 weeks afterwards to recover. We both received nothing but brilliant and compassionate care - particularly from the team of midwives working in Trinity Ward. Despite the understandable difficult circumstances because of Coronavirus, they all went above and beyond to ensure that I could be with my baby while we both recovered. They were caring, understanding and always willing to support me. My start to motherhood could have been very different if it wasn‚Äôt for the staff and I will be forever grateful for the quality of care and treatment I received.

title: Great service under difficult circumstances
body: Thank you for the reassurance received by the doctor yesterday for a skin complaint that was worrying me.  I rang the surgery and promptly received a call from the doctor.  Consultation took place by phone and,despite the surgery computer systems not working (therefore video link not possible) the doctor explained the likely diagnosis and invited me to call again if the problem persists. Thank you for continuing to provide a great service despite all, St Peters!

title: Among the very best
body: I was admitted to the Peninsula for surgery to fuse bones in my foot at the ripe age of 78.   The orthopaedic surgeon did a brilliant job, backed up by an operating theatre team that afforded me both professional skill and every personal consideration, including the specific type of local anaesthesia that I requested.  During the procedure (I was wide awake) the theatre staff were chatty and reassuring.  The ward nursing staff were equally lovely, including their attention to post-operative care 'phone calls when I had gone home.  Three months on and I am out of both plastercast and my attractive orthopaedic aircast boot, with virtually no swelling to the foot and very limited localised discomfort. I have started walking our dog up the next-door field using only my hiking pole and I am doing a bit of easy lawn mowing.  I am building up on my exercise bike. Ballet dancing and abseiling may take a bit longer. Grateful thanks to all you super people at Peninsula - you are my stars!

title: Absolutely TOP CLASS
body: 18th of March - General anesthetic  surgery.  Everyone  looking after me from  arrival at 7:30, , and same day discharge at 16:00, really were first class. An anxious time eased by the positiveness of everyone coupled with a degree of light humour really settled me. So every single nurse, anesthetist, Consultant and Surgeon on that morning onwards allow me please to say 'You done well' and thank you.

title: It is a great prctice with excellent staff and‚Ä¶
body: but I wanted to praise the reception and dispensary for sorting out my recent problem of a repeat prescription - I was away from home when lockdown came in, and was likely to run out of pills if I didnt take a long trip but they sorted it out so efficiently -and saved me from potential exposure with no fuss... so thank you!!!

author: Mett
title: Mental health
body:
Was overwhelmed with high levels of anxiety to point I was unable to function on a daily basis my only hope of surviving a day without self harm was to turn to turning point for support. It was my lifeline, people there are extremely supportive, caring and understanding. They help you identify your strengths as well as listen to your thoughts.  
I‚Äôd recently been supported by Andrew, he‚Äôs extremely understanding shows empathy and extremely knowledgeable on mental health. Andrew on several occasions has supported me through times I didn‚Äôt know where to turn to. After intense listening and helping me explore options to help me through a difficult time I‚Äôd be able to somehow survive yet another day without harming myself I can wholeheartedly say turning point for me is a lifeline in times of struggling with my mental health.  
Thank you all very much

title: Poor quality of service and communication
body: I never leave reviews but I felt I had to as I‚Äôm dissatisfied since joining this surgery Complete lack of care staff are sometimes unhelpful don‚Äôt do what they have agreed to do and just leave you lack of compassion virtually impossible getting an appointment generally very poor as of the rest of the reviews seems impossible for them to agree to do anything I had to attend twice as nurse could not get pads to stick with heart monitoring test and doctors don‚Äôt chase up or keep you updated poor telephone consultations with doctors as to busy to see you in person left in the lurch and just suppose to accept this level of service disgraceful always feel helpless they are good at listening but seems once you leave the surgery your forgotten about sick of going back not getting the problem dealt with not effective at all health has declined since coming here poor poor results

title: High standards of care
body: I got rushed in to have an emergency appendectomy all staff where very kind and caring, I was very anxious and distressed due to being on my own and the current circumstances with covid-19, the nurses where very understanding and very supportive, I was in hospital for 3 days and received a high standard of care, all staff in A&E, surgeons and on orrel ward where amazing, incredibly professional and hardworking

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: In very safe hands.
body: Being a patient at the Renal Unit at Boston House, I cannot praise and thank enough the very very hard working staff. They are all such lovely and kind working people. There is nothing too much trouble for them. The professionalism is second to none and I can always relax once I am in their hands. Thank you to everyone employed in Boston House Renal Unit and of course the ones who volunteer too! How you work to such high standards and for so long each day is unbelievable. With the added issues that the Coronavirus has brought along and the change of lifestyle, unsociable hours and different people with different issues, these NHS workers continue with only their patients in mind. No concern for their own health and safety above their patient , even though they have contact at close quarters and at high risk. Always a smile and reassuring words and the best care. Thank you so very very much to a truly great team. Please stay safe.

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: 10/10 from me!
body: Attended Epsom A+E early evening on Friday 11th April 2020. Two receptionists and no patients except for me in the reception area. Seen by triage Nurse less than 5 mins after arrival and a further 10 mins later a newly appointed(one week in the job) porter wheeled me through to the treatment area where i was quickly seen by a Nursing asst who proceeded to put a line into my arm quickly and painlessly - not an easy task as previously i have had experienced Doctors often fail to find a vein in either of my arms. Shortly thereafter a young junior Indian Doctor - i forget her name) examined me and brought me some pain meds. Chest X-ray quickly followed and approx one hour later my blood test results came back all clear except for some residual fluid in one of my lungs. The Indian Doctor was absolutely wonderful from the moment that she first examined me right through to the moment that i was discharged a couple of hours later - nothing was too much trouble for her and her bedside manner was utterly brilliant - she is going to be a wonderful Consultant one day for sure! oh and the Porter and the nurses that i met were all similarly great. OVERALL: 10/10 from me!

title: Great practice
body: My mum had been suffering with fever, acid reflux, chest tightening for over a week which was aggravated due to anxiety. I contacted NHS 111 who sent an ambulance. The two paramedics becky and mark who attended took the time to assess my mum. All obs were normal apart from a slight temp. They identified she didn't need to attend hospital, however required some treatment. My mum felt anxiety about attending the hospital dut to the corona virus. They stayed with her and reassured her helping calm her anxiety.  They took the time to listen to her concerns about attending the hospital and cleared any misconceptions that were untrue.  They have then gone the extra mile and rang 111 requesting a callback from a doctor. Paramedic mark then directly liased with the doctor who prescribed some antibiotics and acid reflux medication for my mum over the phone. Their professional attitude and willingness to go the extra mile allowed my mum to recieve the treatment she required and prevent an unnecessary trip to the hospital. They also eliminated any concerns she has about attending the hospital should she require treatment in the future. Excellent service providers and a credit to the NHS. Thankyou to both mark and Becky. From zabina and family

title: Amazing ambulance crew
body: My son had a sudden (first) seizure yesterday and the ambulance had arrived within 10 minutes.  The paramedics were efficient, reassuring and very personable.  He was very quickly assessed in Queens A&E, all vitals fine and normal and discharged at 2 am, awaiting further tests.  Again, efficient service.  Thank you to all the NHS staff involved.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: An amazing practice
body:
Myself and my family have been patients at this practice for a number of years and i have always found them to be caring and extremely thorough. This week however i was most impressed. I was sceptical about calling the doctors as they are already under enough strain with dealing with corona virus. However i felt i had a problem which needed to be looked at. As we are in lockdown i spoke to my doctor via telephone, she was working from home. We couldn't connect to a video chat due to a fault, so i sent her a picture of my problem via email. She was very understanding and i certainly didn't feel like i was wasting anyones time. Within an hour she'd made a referral to the hospital and i was sent a letter from them via email. Two days later i had a call from a consultant. 
This is a completely different way of a doctor practicing to how we're all used to and I cannot fault how they're dealing with their patients during lockdown. Thank you,  to you all at The Manor Practice, Sutton Coldfield for your continued help and support.

title: Exellent
body: The staff are amazing ... they help my son so so much .. previous to this we went to James cook they totally fobbed my son off and sent him home !! To him to north tees what a difference they were all kind friendly and amazing I couldn‚Äôt of asked for better they took a proper look at my sons ankle and xrays .. my son has ended up in plaster !!! I think the staff at James cook should go over there to get some training !!!! Thank you to all the staff at north tees u are all amazing

title: Lovely staff, needs new equipment!
body: I was admitted to south bank to have my gall bladder removed. The process only took a few months to arrange & the hospital handled me much better than the Worcester royal. It was my first operation so I was incredibly anxious but the staff were very kind & very informative to every question I had. After my procedure I was admitted over night, where the nurses regularly did tests & offered drinks & food. My only problem was in the night time, I was in a lot of pain after my op & had to be hooked to an IV painkiller which in the night my blood had travelled up into the bag & id also lost control of my bladder during the night causing me to have an accident. I tried using my buzzer several times in the night as I was in a lot of pain, I was panicked about my IV & I needed to get to the toilet but was struggling massively. After a long while of pressing my buzzer, nothing was happening so after about 2 hours I had to wake a neighbouring patient to ask if she could buzz hers for me. A nurse immediately came in & helped me she was so so lovely & I couldn‚Äôt fault her but she said ‚Äúit‚Äôs been ripped out of the wall that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs not working‚Äù which led me t believe it was myself who pulled it out although I hadn‚Äôt moved enough to be able to pull it out. Several hours later another nurse doing my tests mentioned that she heard about my unpleasant experience to which she replied ‚Äúthat buzzer has been broken for ages I don‚Äôt know why they still haven‚Äôt replaced it‚Äù which made me think that it wasn‚Äôt my fault that I had no working buZzer as she had stated that the hospital had known about the buzzer & it hadn‚Äôt been sorted? Which then led to me having to suffer in the night in pain, dehydrated & covered in my own urine. I want to stress again that the staff were lovely & they were amazing when they did see to me but I don‚Äôt think having faulty buzzers is acceptable as I suffer with terrible anxiety & the experience was very distressing for me & I can‚Äôt imagine if it had happened to someone elderly or more vulnerable than myself. I think this needs to be communicated amongst the staff because maybe someone has known about it & not reported?

title: Not person-centred
body:
Please note: This review was submitted over a month before the virus, but was rejected due to it not being specific enough. 

When dealing the GPs at the surgery, I have experienced, on many occasions, a notable lack of respect, a lack of listening skills and superior attitudes, which has lead to me feeling distress and also frustration, as I cannot change surgeries. I do not believe that staff are person-centred at this practice. 
I was also prescribed the wrong medication by a GP which led to having to call back and go through the triage system, only to be told that that no one had access to the relevant information apart from that GP.

title: Amazing
body:
The staff are all very helpful and nice. I never once have felt looked down on or dismissed. Every step of the way I have someone explaining next steps and what I should expect, as well as allowing me to decide what form of therapy I think would work best for me. I've only spoken to my therapist once so far, but she was so welcoming and understanding, even apologising for the long wait time for appointments (Which really isn't their fault, between COVID and being busy, and I never felt like the wait was too long).

Thank you all for being there. It is very hard for me to talk about my feelings and to work through them, you've all been so amazing, and I'm so excited to get the tools to help work through my problems on my own terms. I haven't attended too much as of yet, I've just started, but I feel hopeful for the first time in so long. Best wishes and I hope everyone stays safe.

title: Rehabilitation
body:
My son has been on the list for a 12 week or more rehabilitation after a back operation went wrong & he has limited use of his legs now .
He has a functional neurological disorder & his mental health is suffering to an extreme due to being mostly bed bound & isolated except for Carers & myself (mum).
He is 27 .
The wait to get into this facility is way too long for some one so young & he will be in worse condition nearly 2 years later from when he was assessed nearly 2 years ago . Maudesley is our only hope of him getting any proper professional help , birthday hope is dwindling each day he has to wait for a place

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust
Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

title: Very helpful
body: Thankyou to Pitsmoor Surgery, my son, who I care for, is a patient there.  The surgery is easy to contact, once you know what to do, by email, so much more convenient then trying to get through on the phone, particularly if I am at work.  They give you an option of how youd like to be contacted, email or phone for example, and always contact you as soon as they can. The staff, from reception  to doctors are friendly, approachable  and consistently do their very best to help.   They have weekend and late surgeries, which helps when you are working.  My sons doctor rang after 7.30 one evening to ensure he got his prescription. The communication systems are very efficient and workable.  I wish I personally could attend this practice,  because they see you as soon as possible and make getting in touch with them far less stressful than other surgeries do and are so helpful.   Well done Pitsmoor Surgery, stay safe.üëçüòäüçÄ

author: Illnamar
title: Suspected COV 19
body:
Rang 111 for advice spoke to two different people last person a nurse talked through my symptoms and decided to get me checked by paramedics. A following call from another person also checking my symptoms who still decided to get me checked.  
So paramedics arrive. They were two of them. The first one just took one look at me and just started laying into me. I felt so poorly at this point as well. They said That I have risked the life of themselves and their co worker by me calling them! The reason I had called them was because my breathing had got worse They then said to me that they are only taking people to hosp who are dying at the moment!  
I certainly didn‚Äôt want to go to hosp. I was scared and needed to be checked They made me so upset The first paramedic was brutal in their words to me seeing as I was so poorly. I understand they work extremely hard and are under immense pressure at the moment But their words and the way they acted has made me so anxious and frightened to ever maybe call 111 again. I actually had spoken to my doctor earlier in the day who said if my breathing got worse to call 111 that is what I did. I feel so so upset about how the paramedic was to me. It has really put me off ever calling for help. And it‚Äôs not something I would ever normally do it‚Äôs also the fact that I am an Asthmatic so I have been very frightened of ‚Äò‚Äòtis awful disease

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

author: Bubbly12
title: Staff
body:
Went to A&E at rah paisley as we were advised by doctor on phone. put in a room and left for ages which in normal cases would be okay and bearable, but I am blind and disabled with a lot of health problems, my son who is my carer wasn‚Äôt allowed in despite being told at A&E he could be with me as I was so scared. A nurse then took me round to day surgery unit which is being used for the Covid 19 patients, and it was the most unpleasant experience I have ever had.  
I can appreciate staff are busy and scared themselves at this terrible time but you still need to treat and show your patients kindness and compassion not ignore them when they are crying and are obviously upset. Their manner towards myself and other patients was very brusque and made me feel as if I was a pest and wasting their time. One staff member could hardly talk to me it was as if it was too much effort and felt like they couldn‚Äôt be bothered. I can assure you I don‚Äôt go to hospital unless I am forced to as the nurses have more than enough to do, I got a set of obs done blood pressure etc the usual stuff and then was left sitting there with no buzzer or anyone come ask how I was and if I needed anything toilet etc.  
The X-ray girls were lovely they couldn‚Äôt have been nicer they took me back to my room and I stayed there for hours again with no one coming to see if I was okay or if I needed anything , I felt totally helpless was in agony because I had no pain relief and desperate for toilet but there was no one to ask, instead all you could hear where staff talking rather loudly and laughing about what they did, how they didn‚Äôt like what they were doing and would be glad to get home etc.  
I have never felt so helpless and vulnerable in all my life everybody across the world are out there clapping for the nhs heroes it wasn‚Äôt displayed that day. The only thing that made the experience better was the fantastic care I received from the doctor who was lovely and showed kindness and compassion and said they would call my son explain what was happening, I have been treated by this doctor before and it‚Äôs always the very best care they can give you nothing is any hassle and treats patients with great respect.  
It‚Äôs a shame because it only takes something like this to happen and you lose all your confidence in the people you should trust, I hope I don‚Äôt need to go back think I would rather just stay at home the thought of it fills me with fear

author: colpot54
title: Admittance at a worrying time
body:
I was rushed in to ED and taken to the clean area. Seen within 10 minutes for bloods bp etc then ECG done. Then saw a DR within half an hour had a CT scan and given a diagnosis of MS Relapse within an hour.  
Had to wait for a bed understandably but went to ward 4 at 4,30 in the morning.  
All welcomed booked in cup of tea and a short sleep before day shift came on. i was very happy to see Mark a heart failure specialist who had been redeployed to wards, his care throughout the day was excellent. IM sorry to sat the same can not be said for the night staff on this ward, very noisy at some times very short with the patients and the to top the lot singing with a patient songs at 10.15 pm!! some of us was woken up by this.Then lights out staff talking very loudly at the nurses station for the next three hours. At 5.30 started to take BP's etc I was too tired by then and ignored them.  
Day staff came on and instead of Mark greeted By Stephanie, another redeployed Heart Failure Specialist and a breath of fresh air along with the rest of her team through excellent care and helped my speedy discharge home at 15.30pm.  
Such a shame night staff let them down.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: KayPee
title: Urology Access
body: I was referred to a specialist for an appointment but the first available slot was involved a three month wait. My GP wrote to the hospital to highlight that this needed to be dealt with quickly. I didn‚Äôt receive a reply for a new appointment and as the Covid 19 has since began effecting services my appointment has been cancelled with no indication of when I will be seen. I appreciate these are difficult times but the initial three months before Covid and now I have absolutely no idea how I can access help.

title: Abbey Road Health care centre is great
body: I had a phone consultation because it was a bank holiday and also because of the Coronavirus going on. The doctor was very good. He was very helpful and he recommended something for me straight away. All I had to do was go to the chemist and get the prescription. Thank you for your help. Abbey Road health centre has been my doctor‚Äôs surgery since I was a baby. I‚Äôve been going here all my life and I‚Äôve seen doctor‚Äôs and receptionist‚Äôs come & go, but they have all been nice. I would never change my doctors surgery ever. Thank you for making us well again doctors, especially in this time of crisis with the Coronavirus going on. Thank you NHS.

title: Shocking
body: I‚Äôve been under mental health for over half of my life. Always seen by this place, always parred off and pushed away. I‚Äôm 18 now. I would‚Äôve been about 10 when I was first referred. Time and time again to sit in a room with someone to ask awful personal questions. To not help at all and par me off to another organisation that can help me even less. Just to be sent back to do it all again. One of the most awful experiences of my life and I‚Äôve lost count how many times I‚Äôve had to do it! How dare any of you sit there and claim you help people, not only that you‚Äôre meant to be helping children! I‚Äôm angry and disgusted at the fact I know I‚Äôm not the only one. And other kids will grow up trying to battle through the same system. Confused and wondering why them. Why no one could be bothered to help. Then fighting even more to get help the older you get. You should all be ashamed of yourselves and I hope at least one person feels guilt reading this. Because there‚Äôs a lot of you.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

title: excellent care
body: Didn't really like to go in these times with the covid-19. But I was in so much pain. I was dealt with lovely. Both by triage and the doctor. Turned out to be a water infection. Was given meds and am now getting better. This was during the night and I was in and out witthin half a hour. Thank you

title: Good experience
body:
I had reason to telephone on the emergency helpline yesterday the girl who spoke to me was very calming and knowledgable she asked a series of questions and before long had arranged an ambulance.when the crew arrived I was given an ECG and various tests were carried out a copy of all my history and medication was taken. They stayed with me for sometime before leaving to make sure I was ok. Very professional throughout the visit 
.

title: Soul destroying experience
body: Referred to discuss Elective double mastectomy only saw consultant 3 times very briefly during this time my mother had died from breast cancer. No discussion on impact it would mentally have, complications, procedure. No breast care nurse offered, counselling or concern after numerous complications from infection and huge weight loss. Instead response was everything they did was fine and I was neurotic. After pulling care and going to another Trust in a different county the consultant could not even rectify the mess by continuing with the reconstruction as planned. No apology Or acknowledgement for the trauma this has caused my family from Glenfield other than they are sorry for the trauma my mother dying has caused! Shocking!! Very saddened that this dangerous lack of duty of care for a patient can happen in our nhs that are meant to protect us but all that obviously doesn‚Äôt matter when they want to protect their jobs rather than help someone that desperately needed someone to hear them :(

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Fast appointment and excellent follow up care
body: I needed an urgent appointment for my 11 year old who had become quite unwell overnight. I was expecting to have to really emphasise our need to be seen but we were offered an appointment that day, despite calling later than the usual time for appointments. The surgery showed flexibility and support in ensuring we were seen and taken seriously at a worrying time. Treatment was immediately offered despite some uncertain symptoms. We were also given much reassurance and information. The Doctor called the next day (on his day off!) to see how my child was doing which showed care well and beyond anything we would expect at a time when the NHS is so stretched. We returned for a follow up where again we were reassured. I felt that we had received excellent care and attention from the point of urgency right through to my child's improved wellness, much to our satisfaction. Thank you so much.

title: On-line Registration
body: I am not uo to date with computers. I had problems registering for on-line access to my medical records. I was talked through the process with simple instructions and patience.

title: Excellent!!
body:
I was referred here by my optician after an emergency appointment, with a suspected detached retina. 
I was extremely worried and quite anxious, not only about my condition, but of course about the possibility of coming into contact with Corvid-19. 
It appeared that I was the only patient there, the waiting rooms were empty and the experience was a little eerie. However, the staff, from the security guards, to the receptionist, the nurse and the doctor, were absolutely brilliant. All my questions answered, and my treatment explained by the lovely doctor. My surgery will go ahead as soon as there is anaesthetist availability. I feel confident and assured, that my surgery and treatment will be handled well at this facility. Thank you so much for being there for us.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: NHS HEROES!
body: I attended the Day Surgery for a mastectomy due to breast cancer. I was extremely nervous because I had to attend with no family support due to Covid 19 risks. On my arrival, I was greeted with sunshine and efficiency from the lovely receptionist which put me at ease. Following this, a very friendly and attentive nursing staff ensured that I was thoroughly prepped. The surgical team were highly skilled and performed the procedure exactly as they described. They all had an amazing ability to keep me calm and reassured. Finally, the post-surgery team were phenomenal; ensuring that I didn‚Äôt feel alone or wanting for anything. They were a god send at a time when I needed support the most. I cannot praise them enough.

title: Excellent care and communication
body: I am so grateful for the care I received from the team on the above date. I telephoned to ask if I could speak a Dr about my health concerns. The receptionist asked if I would share my concerns with her.  I had no hesitation to share with her as a valued member of the team. She explained that she would pass in my information to the Dr and he would call me back. Soon after the Dr called me, when I explained my health issues he said he was going to call an ambulance. His effective care and communication is always excellent. I went to hospital for urgent tests, received a diagnosis and treatment and returned home later that evening.  If it wasn't for the lady on reception recognising I needed to speak to the Dr urgently and the Dr acting so quickly on the information provided to him, my outcome may not have been so good.  Despite the stress, volume if work, staff off poorly caused by the Coronavirus, I still received as always a first class service from this practice. The effective communication was the key to this and it all began when I shared my concerns with the first frontline member of the team who has an important role to play and that certainly happened in my case. I feel extremely lucky to be a registered patient at this practice. Thank all very much for everything you do.

title: Excellent service despite current circumstances
body: With very unfortunate timing, I needed antibiotics for a urine infection during the Coronavirus pandemic - added to that it was Easter Monday. My call was answered by the receptionist within seconds and a GP had called me back within 5 mins for a telephone appointment - both GP and receptionist were very friendly and understanding. Given the circumstances, my prescription was sent to the Day Lewis Pharmacy next door immediately and I didn‚Äôt need to attend the surgery. I have always been very happy with the service from the Maples team but was so impressed with how great it was today. Thank you!

title: Impeccable treatment  from Consulants to cleaners
body:
On 29th January 2020 I was taken by ambulance to A& E with a blocked artery but a nurse from cardiology spotted my information from the readings sent by the extraordinary ambulance team. She came to find me & I was whisked up to the Cardiology Department. After a quick discussion of the risks attached to the procedure I was treated immediately A clot was removed and a stent inserted into the damaged artery. This prompt action undoubtedly saved me from lasting damage and probable disability , even death. Another problem was spotted during the procedure so I was scheduled to have a similar stent inserted in the other suspect artery before discharge. The initial procedure took approximately 3 hours from our first call to 111 to being nursed and monitored closely that evening. I now have 2 fully functioning stents, a supply of medication & a wealth of information about rehabilitation.
I simply cannot thank all those involved, including the nursing , cleaning & kitchen staff for their professionalism which in every case was carried out with kindness , compassion and good humour.  Whilst I was there I witnessed the care given to my fellow patients and I can honestly say it was equally compassionate and of an exemplary standard. Thank you all for giving me and so many others our lives back.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: I phoned the surgery on bank holiday Monday with muscular spasms in my back. Receptionist took details, I was phoned back within 40 minutes and was told a prescription would be waiting at the pharmacy for me. Absolutely excellent service. I was so relieved as I was in a lot of pain.

author: Faster consulation
title: Remote consultation success
body:
Visited nurse at first to look at a lesion on the back of my hand, but was passed to a doctor who decided I should be referred to consultant. I was quite happy about this but expected to wait several weeks at best for an appointment.  
Within 8 days I was notified of an appointment only four weeks away (Mid April). I then received a cancellation letter in the first week of April, due to the coronavirus lockdown procedures. I expected this and was prepared to wait for some time before things progressed but was surprised, on the next day, to receive another notification of an appointment, with a different doctor at a different time on the same day.  
But I also received an email from this doctor, Dr Wylie, asking if I could send him a picture of my lesion. I did this the same day and promptly received a reply, with his opinion on the problem and suggesting some initial treatment. The necessary prescription had already been sent to my GP and they contacted me by phone to let me know they had it and it was being sent to a pharmacy - I stress that this was all done on the same day!  
I feel that this is an outstanding service and everyone involved deserves the highest praise.

readBy.name: Office of Ken Macintosh, MSP for West of Scotland

title: Friendly and Helpful Doctors Surgery
body: I was worried about joining this practice after reading some of the reviews, but I‚Äôve had a great experience every time I‚Äôve visited Bennett‚Äôs End Surgery. The receptionists are warm, friendly and will always try to help you, even in the mornings when they‚Äôre very busy. I have always managed to get an appointment when I‚Äôve rung up at 8am, although I appreciate that this isn‚Äôt practical for some people. I‚Äôve also found it easy to get review appointments with the same doctor for continuity. Every doctor I‚Äôve seen has been really helpful.

author: performanceqt57
title: siempre les estar√© agradecido/ I will be forever Grateful
body:
Uno de los cat√©teres se sali√≥ del ri√±on  
Fui al University College Hospital de Londres y me atendieron de forma r√°pida y eficiente. Al d√≠a siguiente me intervinieron y colocaron el cat√©ter en su lugar. Tuve infecci√≥n y me hospitalizaron por una noche en observaci√≥n. Encontr√© a enfermeros y doctores muy amables y con mucha experiencia. Les felicito pues solucionaron mi emergencia y siempre les estar√© agradecidos por esta atenci√≥n. Dios los bendiga!  
Translation:-  
One of the Catheters Came out of my Kidney.  
I went to University College Hospital In London and they treated me quickly and efficiently. The following day I had a procedure and had a catheter inserted. I developed an infection, was hospitalised and kept under observation for one night. I found the nurses and doctors kind and very experienced. I am full of praise for the way you handled my medical emergency and I will be forever grateful for the care I received. God bless you!

title: Brilliant support when I had Covid 19
body: Had Covid19 was brilliantly supported by the practice. They could not have done more to help. All the staff were brilliant. They checked in on me daily etc

title: Needs improvement
body: My God! I found my recent experience at the practice ever so dreadful. I had a telephone consultation booked in with the GP. The Doctor had called me about my problem. I found her totally unprofessional, kept on speaking over me, did not give me a chance to explain my problem to her and I got nowhere and ended up calling 111. The receptionists there are running round like headless chickens too.

title: Rude reception staff - again...!
body:
I called in to the surgery today to collect my repeat prescription. I realise that as we have just started a lockdown period for the coronavirus that people are finding this a stressful time. However, rudeness doesn't cost anything and I yet again find myself complaining about the reception staff at Broom Lane. Their rudeness knows no bounds (one receptionist in particular). She spoke to me as though I was something unpleasant on her shoe! This is not an unusual occurrence and I keep complaining on this site about it but nothing ever seems to change. 

I am so annoyed that I am considering changing my GP practice to one where the receptionists are pleasant and know how to smile.  It's bad enough having to attend a GP surgery at the best of times.  But my experience today made me feel as though I had no right to be there.  Please, please can the reception staff be given some training on their front of house skills and undergo some scrutiny to ensure they are applying what they learn? General politeness should come naturally, but in this case it doesn't. It's such a shame that the conduct of the reception staff gives such a negative impression of a practice which is otherwise very good.

title: Not a clue
body: Signage on the information board says don‚Äôt enter the building if you have any of these symptoms you‚Äôre already 50 metres in when you‚Äôre reading it for Coronavirus don‚Äôt think these people have been made aware of the virus if what I was hearing was true about suspected people with it had been in why were they allowed in and why did these thick people even go in.

title: Great practice with great staff, kind and caring.
body:
Such a great Practice, all staff always try their best to help.
In these Corona Virus times I've had reason to go the surgery this week and couldn't wish for a better service from all the staff there who are all pitching in and working there socks off so us the patients still get a great service.
Thankyou Sutterton Surgery, you should all be proud of the fantastic service you give to us.

author: Patricia1949
title: My cancer journey.
body:
I was diagnosed with breast cancer in October 2018. following this I went through chemotherapy, surgery, radiothapy (at Maidstone) and more targeted treatment. Every department have been so kind and supportive. So big big thanks to:  
The Breast Care Clinic and the Breast Care Nurses, Dr Abson-Oncologist and all the wonderful team at the Galton Unit,, Mr El Gammal- Surgeon for such a tidy "job" and a great sense of humour, all the staff and technicians in Nuclear medicine. If I have forgotten anyone I apologise and say thank you to them too.  
Sadly having come through all this my husband died in January on Keats Ward- but they were great too!

title: Good and some worries
body:
I visited with my wife on Wednesday, 18th March for a 2.00 pm appt. We were seen promptly, told that we were attending the Virtual EMD Clinic. The eye test completed in 5 minutes and drops put in prior to imaging. Then had to wait 30 minutes for a retinal scan and retinal photography. No explanation why we had to wait that long but we were grateful because we were out in 50 minutes - very quick compared to previous visits. So, good marks for that.

A worrying detail during our 30 minutes sitting, watching, was the people who came in without using the hand sanitiser on the reception desk. About 12 people came in to the reception desk but half of them did not clean their hands nor were invited to by the receptionists. A number of the chairs in the waiting areas have arms which are perfect vectors for viruses from unclean hands. Two ladies came in and used the toilets - touching the handles without hand hygiene. Disappointing.

author: HamsterBanana97
title: HCA went above & beyond
body:
On two different occasions I was in Stoke Mandeville a&e. One the first occasion after having arrived at 12am and sitting until 3am for ops and then throughout the night having nothing. When change over happened one lovely health care assistant straight away came over and took my ops. She listened to my partner and I rant about how the night care had been less that adequate and then went above and beyond through out the rest of our 4 hours there. Again tonight I was taken into Stoke Mandeville and Alice the HCA was on the night shift. Straight away she was again going above and beyond to try and help. I wish for Alice to be given the recognition that she so rightfully deserves.  
Thank you Alice for all your help.

author: One lucky grateful lady
title: One of the lucky ones
body:
I was admitted to ward 9 for a mastectomy last Tuesday and so grateful I was able to get this done as the ‚Äòwindow‚Äô for such operations is unpredictable.  
The staff were absolutely lovely, friendly, helpful, supportive, understanding and professional at all times. The ward staff, anaesthetists, surgeon, Breast Care Nurse June, theatre staff, porter, domestics, physiotherapists and anyone else who was involved in my care a big thank you to you all.  
I am one of the lucky ones, because working at BGH I knew a lot of them so I saw familiar faces all the time and felt like I had visitors. However, those patients who didn‚Äôt have visitors, the staff kept their spirits up with their care and attention to each individual leaving no one out. Even though the ward was so busy there was always someone there to help or check if you needed anything. It was also good to see how the staff all supported each other in taking over tasks to cover for breaks.  
Due to the COVID-19 a lot of the staff on the ward when I was in were from different areas within NHS Borders but just took to the challenges that they all face.  
I got home Thursday and I am so proud to work for NHS Borders with fantastic colleagues. Everyone is doing such a good job in whatever role they are playing, please stay safe because we still need you all after this is all over and we come out even stronger.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Tremendous courage and skill in the face of‚Ä¶
body: Superb treatment from a very brave team at the heart of the Covid crisis. Outstanding surgery with great humanity. I would like the team to know I am doing very well and wish them all the luck in the world.

title: Great Practice
body:
All the staff and doctors are really helpful, nothing is ever too much trouble, always get an appointment Or a ring back when needed. 
Keep up the good work.

title: Warmly greeted
body:
Just like to say a big thank you to the staff for the safeguarding procedures put in place during the coronavirus pandemic.
I was warmly greeted by both the receptionist and nurse when I visited this morning for my quarterly injection and really appreciate that this service was still available in the current situation.
Thank you and take care.

title: Excellent medical care.
body: I had an Oxford Unicompartmental  Knee replacement performed by the same excellent surgeon who fixed my right knee four years ago and the outcome so far after five weeks has been even better. My stay at the Crowborough hospital was absolutely fantastic. Every single member of staff from the Porter to the Consultant were cheerful, positive and relaxed and I felt in safe hands. The hospital was spotless and the food fantastic. Even the clerical staff were very efficient. Nothing was too much trouble for anyone. I didn't want to go home as it was such a positive experience. I would definitely use their services again and recommend them to family, friends and colleagues. Thank you to all the wonderful staff at the Horder Centre for giving me my quality of life back and allowing me to do all the things I enjoy again. N Powney, Seaford.

title: Excellent phlebotomist
body: the man who did my bloods today was super! Cheerful and welcoming despite COVID19 conditions and took my blood with absolutely no pain at all. I have had him before and it was the same so no coincidence! The appointment was on time, the receptionist was friendly and very efficient given the hygiene and safety regime we are under at the moment.  well done to them all and especially the phlebotomist whose name I am sure you know!

title: Blood test
body:
Attended for routine blood test today.
Surprised to see no hand sanitiser for patient use despite the current situation regarding the Coronavirus.
No one asked if I had a new cough or temperature either.
I was asked to look away while my blood sample was taken to protect us both.
Can I suggest using single use tourniquets as a form of infection control, I believed this was nhs policy anyway ?

readBy.name: Staffordshire and Stoke on Trent Partnership NHS Trust

title: Amazing practice
body: Selfless staff and amazing bedside manner. Made my grandmother in law feel comfortable and eased her anxieties which was a challenge for them as she wasn‚Äôt exactly the most cooperative patient during her stay! Unfortunately she passed away just over a month ago but I know she would want to show her support and gratitude to the staff that worked tirelessly to ensure her health and well-being were paramount (especially during such a challenging time for nhs workers). Just wanted to sing their praises really and show our support for such amazing, incredible people. You truly are superheroes. Thank you, Lucy xxxx

title: Dermatology appointment
body:
My review relates to experiences before covid19. 

Awful experience trying to book for a follow up appointment after having blood tests done. Managed to get an appointment three weeks after having a blood test done, waited an hour to be seen and then was told that my blood results are not loading on the system and actually the system has been like this for a while. Could have saved myself the time and journey if I was notified earlier. Was told another appointment would be booked in a weeks time, it‚Äôs now been over 4 weeks and I haven‚Äôt heard anything. Have gone round in very frustrating circles for the last 3 months and still don‚Äôt have a solution. Would not recommend.

title: Doctors excellent, repeat prescriptions big‚Ä¶
body:
The Doctors and Nurses at this surgery are excellent. 
The problem is getting  an appointment.
We have also had many problems with repeat prescriptions over the years, not due to the vivid 19 outbreak , my wife needs life saving medication due to  chronic asthma,  recently she has had to ring up the surgery after waiting 10 days for a repeat prescription to be processed, it still hadn't been processed  then.
When enquiring as to what has happened  to the prescription , we are told it's been sent to our designated pharmacy ,when enquiring at the pharmacy  we found this had not been done.
Totally unacceptable

title: Brilliant
body: I attended today , they were brilliant . The Covid 19 virus is really bad . I have 2 illnesses which make me high risk . Everybody had the temperature taken . We had to stand 2 metres apart and use hand sanitizer . The Dentist put me at ease as I have a dentist phobia . The standard of care I received was brilliant . All staff were so helpful and the standard of care was very high

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: E consult
body: In the midst of a serious health pandemic, Newton place surgery asked me to complete an online E consult form. Within half an hour I‚Äôd had a video consultation with a GP and an electronic prescription sent to pharmacy. What a fantastic service

title: Good practice
body: Whilst I agree that getting an appointment is difficult, please bear in mind that if your appointment is urgent i.e. because you are  suddenly unwell or have become worse healthwise, the practice will make every effort  see you. They have extended the opening hours but have limited facilities to employ more doctors, though the addition of a nurse practitioner no doubt has helped. Presumably the capacity issue might change when they move to bigger premises.  In terms of medical care, I've been a patient there for many years and can honestly say I have never had a problem; the current staff complement as far as doctors go are patient, empathetic and clinically very good. Yes, sometimes the reception staff can be a little terse, but if you see that on may occasions the phones are non stop and there are people queuing up to ask questions, make appointments, request home visits etc and are not always polite, it is understandable.

title: Problems with on line repeat prescription log in.
body: When on Lister house surgery Hatfield website there is no obvious local log in. Whatever I try it takes me back to general NHS site as if I was trying to register for the first time! In the end I usually finish phoning in and the receptionist books the prescription rather than showing me where to log in ( it is quicker ), so the electronic service due to bad programming actually wastes time instead of saving. Please alter the website so that there is obvious direct link!

title: Many issues with patient records
body:
The staff at this practice obviously mean well and usually try hard, but they are hamstrung by their poor data practices.

They've done a number of strange things like enter conditions into my record and try to treat me for them... without ever actually making a diagnosis or even discussing them with me.

I'm registered as preferring contact by email but this is routinely ignored; they will call and text me which doesn't work very well when I'm outside the UK.

They book me in for consults with other NHS services without telling me, which wastes my time and the time of other clinics when I don't show for a consult I was never told about. It starts to rise to malpractice if my records are being shared for referrals made without my knowledge or consent.

I understand everyone is working extra hard right now, but these issues date to well before the COVID-19 crisis. If they were sloppy with diagnoses and medical records in January who knows what they're doing today during the crisis.

You need to be an informed and active patient if you want to use this practice. Insist on regularly seeing your records because the odds are high you will be surprised by mistakes and strange entries. I wish them well but perhaps they need another full timer or two simply on records alone as this is not the time to be making mistakes with medical data.

title: Fantastic
body:
Good job to victoria medical centre with all the chaos happening around us,in keeping the surgery running in the circumstances we are facing today.
Praise to the manager for coordinating everything and praise to the doctors and nurses and staff.keep up the great wofk

title: Beyond the call of duty in a pandemic
body: I can't even begin to describe how wonderful this surgery has been to me. I am one of the vulnerable patients who cannot leave home and I was struggling to get my prescriptions from the pharmacy. I was terribly worried because one of them was critical for my health and well being and I was out completely. One of the staff brought them to me on his way home from work. He went far beyond what was required to help me in the midst of this pandemic. I am so grateful and so impressed. Wonderful people! I wish I could commend him by name, but the rules say I can't. I've been very happy with this surgery and everyone I've seen there since I became a patient.
